# effectiveRadius(corner:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the effective radius for the corner you provide, calculated using the view’s current corner configuration.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func effectiveRadius(corner: UIRectCorner) -> CGFloat
```

## Parameters

- **corner**: The corner whose effective radius you want to calculate.

## Return Value

A `CGFloat` value for the effective radius, expressed in points.

## Overview

When you call this method from [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/layoutSubviews()], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/updateProperties()], or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController/updateProperties()], automatic invalidation occurs if the effective radius changes. If you provide more than one corner (for example, [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIRectCorner/allCorners]), the returned radius represents the maximum effective radius of those corners.

## Configuring a view’s corners

- **cornerConfiguration**: A configuration that defines the corners of the view.
- **UICornerConfiguration**: A configuration that defines how corner radii are mapped to the corners of a rectangle.
- **UICornerRadius**: A type that represents the radius the system uses to round a corner.
